awd_titl_txt: Application of Paleomagnetism to Investigate Inclined       Sheet/Conesheet Emplacement Mechanisms
awd_abstract_narration: Despite the evident importance of cone sheets in basalt                         volcanic systems, cone sheet complexes are still poorly                         understood and their origin is the subject of several                           competing hypotheses. We will apply paleo-magnetic                              techniques to test these hypotheses in two study areas: the                     Cuillin Hills of Skye (Scotland) in the roots of a major                        early-Tertiary basaltic volcano; and Kalfafellsdalur, a                         deeply eroded Quaternary spreading ridge in SE Iceland.  We                     will use the NRM orientation to determine whether the                           centrally-inclined character of the sheet-intrusions is due                     to post-intrusion tilting.  We will determine the magma-flow                    direction by magnetic susceptibility anisotropy, and we will                    estimate thermal gradients in country rock adjacent to                          sheets by paleomagnetism.
